name: Princess Heights

reviews.title: Excellent accommodations
reviews.text: We went to St. Maarten/St. Martin in early March . This is one island shared by two countries – The Netherlands and France. We stayed on the Dutch side in a hillside hotel condominium style Princess Heights.

I can sum up the accommodations in one word – luxury. This one-bedroom apartment with 1.5 baths, had marble floors, granite tops, huge terrace, full kitchen, etc. We got a very good deal on --- that included free massages in the condo, breakfast daily, a car for a week, and other nice ammenities. You can ask the hotel to do grociery shopping for you which is a bit pricey, but once you get off a 6-hour flight it was nice to have fruits and drinks pre-ordered, waiting in the fridge for us. The hotel has a 1-800 number from the States - it's on their webpage - and you can talk directly to the manager. So we called in advance for the food and the shuttle they sent to the airport.
reviews.title: BEWARE THE CONSTRUCTION NOISE

reviews.text: All the staff of the hotel was wonderful – responsive and pleasant. The maids clean the condo, serve you breakfast, do laundry and load the dishwasher.
reviews.title: Excellent vacation
You may not be able to use Dawn Beach anymore.
reviews.text: Our ocean view suite had St. Barths in the distance and the beach beneath us. BUT there is a heavy construction work at the bottom of the hill for Westin resorts and an expansion of the Princess right next to the suites so it is loud and dusty all day. Don't let it be the highlight of the trip though!

reviews.title: First Class Honeymoon
reviews.text: Also, the hotel is located in the Oyster Pond area, which is largely residential community with small 2-storey French hotels and restaurants and a magnetic marina.

reviews.title: Princess Heights was our home away from home
reviews.text: We stayed for 8 days at the Princess Heights in a one bedroom suite and it was amazing. Most people say that the accomodations are overly priced but based on our experince there it's seems like great value for the money. There's a full kitchen so if you want to eat in you can and you also have a dishwasher (in case you're not feeling in a very gungho mood about cleaning up). There's daily maids service which shows up everyday unnlike some hotels and the staff are very friendly and more than willing to accomodate your needs. Based on the location of the 'hotel' you get a great view of the ocean and Dawn Beach down below, along with this you get a nice breeze every day and it's great just to walk outside and be able to hear the waves and see them too (you dont't get this chance with a few of the other hotels in St. Martin). Overall I think that we had a very enjoyable experience and urge others to stay at Princess Heights, it's definitly worth it.

reviews.title: Views to die for
reviews.text: My wife and I just returned from our honeymoon in St. Maarten. Princess Heights was our choice because of it's romantic appeal. It is a wonderful place to stay if you're searching for natural beauty, majestic views, peace and quiet.

When we arrived we were greeted with strawberries, champagne, candles, and rose petals. Plus, almost everything was there to make us feel at home: dishwasher, washing machine, fully-equipped kitchen. The rooms are clean, spacious and well-appointed. Bathrooms had modern fixtures including a whirlpool tub.
reviews.title: It Was Wonderful
Overpriced for what you get
reviews.text: The hotel fits in very nicely with the other homes perched high on the hillside. We woke up every morning with the sun as it rose over St. Barth's on the horizon.

reviews.title: 100% Perfect-no complaints!
reviews.text: Although the staff is reliable and responsive, Princess Heights lacks the extensive service and amenities that distinguish it from a resort instead of just a condo/hotel. It has no restaurant of its own, but Mr. Busbsy's and Scavengers are lazy beachside bars/grills within walking distance. It is elegant but refreshingly unportentous, and I would argue that this is part of it's charm. Furthermore, some of our best experiences were just driving around the island and exploring it for ourselves.

We just returned from a seven night stay at Princess Heights. For the first time in all of our vacation travel experience, the property actually turned out to be even nicer than we anticipated from photos and reviews. Our two bedroom, two level suite was absolutely luxurious, spacious, beautifully decorated and immaculate. Our two tiered balcony overlooked St. Barths and was delightful. The staff from the management to the concierge to the cleaning people were so friendly, helpful and courteous. We honestly could only find one thing to complain about and it had nothing to do with Princess Heights. The Westin below was having electrical problems and had their noisy back up generator on for three days. We made several complaints to the Westin and understand that this is going to be remedied soon possibly through the courts. There was a tiny bit of construction going on in the new section of PH, but it did not bother us one bit. We definitely hope to return someday!
reviews.title: Exceeded Our Expectations

likes.liked: — The location and the gorgeous suite with amazing views.

reviews.text: My teen age son and I had a fantastic vacation at the Princess Heights. Our unit was extremely clean and comfortable. The views are incredible. The kitchen was very useful and very well stocked with pots/pans etc. The staff here was exceptional. Very friendly and inviting. They met us at the entrance and took us straight to the unit. They were very helpful at arranging for a rental car and having it delivered. They were very knowledgeable about the island and gave great advice about restaurants and activities. The walk down to the beach is a bit steep, but not very long, and worth the few minutes that it takes to get there. The water was beautiful and the restaurant at the Westin was fun. Overall, this hotel is one where you you get a lot for your money given the comfort, location, cleanliness, and exceptional staff.
reviews.title: perfect place to stay

likes.liked: — The location, cleanliness, safety, and friendliness of the staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at Princess Heights for several days in July, 2007. I was prompted to write this (rather long) evaluation due to the lack of detailed and consistent reviews with regard to this hotel and the construction currently taking place in the surrounding area.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay

reviews.text: Our one bedroom unit was large and well maintained, and looked relatively new. The floors throughout were marble tile. The unit had one full bath and one half bath. It was appointed with comfortable furniture and equipped with all the standard amenities (safe, iron, blow-dryer, etc.). The pictures on the hotel’s web site are an accurate depiction of the rental suite.
reviews.title: Awesome!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The real gem of this unit is, of course, the balcony. It is large and offers access from both the living room and the bedroom, through oversize French doors. The doors in the living room are particularly pleasing, as they swing open into the living room and lend an airy feel to the room. As a result, one can enjoy the balcony even while sitting on the living room sofa.
reviews.title: Home away from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned yesterday from a 5 night stay at Princess Heights. This was our 6th visit their. Unfortunately, with the building of the Westin things have changed. There is ongoing construction at the Princess Heights as well as The Westin . If you want to sit out on the balcony at all during the day the noise is non stop. Even at night there is noise from the air conditioners at The Westin. There is no access to Dawn Beach now except by walking through The Westin which is a pain . The Princess Heights itself has nice rooms and the staff is friendly but if you are looking for peace and quiet this is not the place for you.
reviews.title: Noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Princess Heights for one week from Dec.28-Jan04, 2007 in a one bedroom condosuite. The place is clean, spotless, comfortable and well kept . The rooms are all large and open with lots of light . There are marble floors throughout the entire condosuite and it has central airconditioning. The balconies are very large and overlook the ocean and St. Barts. We spent many mornings and early evenings out on the balconies taking in the beauty that is Dawn Beach . St. Barts looks so close you could touch it . The landscaping is beautiful and the pool is huge and can easily accomodate the additional 18 units being built up on the hill . The condosuite has a complete working kitchen with all the utensils the chef in you would need . The staff is extremely friendly, thoughtful, helpful and professional. The maids are wonderful and very meticulous. Our unit did not have a washer/dryer in-unit but the maids took a few things we had to be laundered . This place is run like a 5-STAR hotel , yet , has the charming and quaint ambience of a family run private paradise hotel. We went to Dawn Beach everyday . You can access it thru the Westin Hotel across the street . For those that want to drive to Dawn Beach , The Westin has made a right-of-way that is government sanctioned for the public to access the beach. You drive thru the gate between the white fence and the Westin parking garage to the very back (almost to the beach ). There are 9 parking spots there for the public. You just walk around the building 10 meters and you are on Dawn Beach . We walked to Dawn Beach from Princess Heights because the access is so easy , directly across the street, about 500 barefoot steps. We also found that the Westin has brought some wonderful amenities to Princess Heights without having all the added "guests" around . ( the Westin has 310 guest rooms ) We hit the Dawn Beach casino everynight and their bar . We also shopped at the Westins Little Switzerland shop and ate at their restaurants , but were always able to retreat to our nice little quiet slice of heaven at Princess Heights . We got all the benefits of using the Westin without actually having to stay there . There is still light construction going on from 8am-5pm in the Dawn Beach area at the Westin and Princess Heights , but it did not bother us . When the construction in the area is complete and Dawn Beach gets back to it normal quiet enclave , it's going to be the premiere spot in all of SXM. We had a wonderful stay and are looking to get back there in May 2007 for my husbands birthday .
reviews.title: This is THE place to stay !

likes.liked: — The Views of the Ocean & St. Bart's and the spacious accomodations .
likes.disliked: — Having to leave and go back to reality

reviews.text: Boutique hotel was unbelievably nice... and the staff is superb. I would recomend the Princess Heights once the Westin is done being built.
reviews.title: Noisy for now

likes.liked: — Size of accomodation and the staff
likes.disliked: — small ants all over the place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rent a car while there because Dawn Beach only offers so much.
reviews.title: nice condo hotel

reviews.text: We’ve stayed at this Condominium Hotel for two years in a row. We’d love the place. Especially with the children a fully equipped kitchen is very handy. Some of the units have a washer and dryer as well. One day we went to St.Barths. This beautiful Island you could even see from your porch at PH. Dawn Beach, across the street of the property is easy accessible through Mr. Busby’s. I really recommend renting a car.
reviews.title: Dream Vacation

likes.disliked: — hard to get to beach, mostly drove a distance to go to other beaches

reviews.text: This was the nicest place we ever stayed in the Caribbean. We've rented villas on the island at Wyndam and Royal Palm, St. Thomas, Bahamas but this was the BEST. Most rentals don't have everything you need, not at the Princess, they have thought of everything. Our only complaint was....are you ready....no coasters for your drinks. LOL
reviews.title: Wow - Very Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pictures do not lie. We were in the new building on the 4th floor 2-bedroom unit. The couch was so comfortable I fell asleep one night on it. Stainless steel appliances, 3 flat-screens, 2 balconies, whirlpool tubs, even a mini-kitchen off the 2nd bedroom. Nicely decorated.
reviews.title: Loved our Room!!!!

reviews.text: Views are of Dawn Beach/St. Barts and hills to the left.
reviews.title: Confirm new building

reviews.text: You will need a rental car but once you know how to get around the island you will realize how convenient the location is for exploring the island.
reviews.title: Loved It!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: NOTE: When arriving there is an intercom under the walk-away above the pool. If you ring it they will come up and drive with you up to the room. Its a crazy twisting road but worth it for the views. If you call prior to arriving on the left hand side of the road is a guarded gate - go up that road to get to your rooms and they check you in right in the room.
reviews.title: We couldn't have asked for more

reviews.text: At first sorry for my english....
reviews.title: Very very nice except.......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed one nigt in this hotel, and I must confess that it's one of the best room I got in SXM.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a quiet area

reviews.text: Brand new, very big and big volume, nice view ( I got the room1104) and very well equiped ( nice kitchen and beautiful, beautiful bathroom).
reviews.title: Room not ready-construction begins 8:30 a.m.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: + : view, room quality, very good bed, very helpuf staff
reviews.title: Local atmosphere - resort setting - peacefull

likes.disliked: — having to check out and leave

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - : access ( i was in th new building ) , no elevator ( out of service so 3 floors-stairs to go in my room) , noise ( building is not finish yet so at 08.00 am, workers are here....
reviews.title: Exceptional Hotel - Great Location and views to die for !!

likes.liked: — Everything ! Especially the views and the balconies.

reviews.text: My family loved the hotel (we stayed in Tower 2) and had a new condo unit. It was beautifully decorated and spotless. The hotel staff couldn't be nicer and they were so accommodating. The rooms were so clean that I let my children walk around barefoot. The view was also spectacular and breathtaking - except the view of The Westin rooftop was a bit of an eyesore. The only complaint that we had was the location. If you want to be away from all of the hustle and bustle of the island, then this hotel is perfect. Otherwise, it's far from the markets, the beaches (Dawn beach is very windy and rough for children) AND the drive to the hotel is a bit frightening for those who are afraid of steep, windy roads. Other than that, it REALLY is a beautiful property. We've been going to St. Martin every year for 10 years and the accommodations have been the best so far, other than renting a private villa.
reviews.title: Exceptional Hotel - Lousy Location

reviews.text: We stayed at Princess Heights for February vacation. The place is so fantastic, it is away from the HonkyTonk of Maho and Simpson Bay as well as the Concrete Jungle that Cupecoy had become. It is located in a more secluded area of the Island, which we preferred. I suggest a rental car for your stay as there is much to see on the Island and it is easier to get around.
reviews.title: Fantastic Location/Fantastic Price for 5-Star Quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We requested unit # 1106 and got it. It is decorated beautifully and has most everything you need for your vacation. Stainless steel appliances, granite countertops, marble bathrooms, tub with jacuzzi , shower, double sinks and a fully stocked kitchen for cooking. A/C works crazy good - cools the rooms off very quickly.
reviews.title: Overpriced
My wife will more than likely be staying at Princess Heights on our next trip to
reviews.text: There is free high speed internet access in the rooms ( bring a cord - altho we forgot one - the front office supplied us one for our stay ) The internet access was faster than mine at home LOL ! The balconies are large with a table and 6 chairs, great for dinner or breakfast , and overlook the ocean and St. Barts. 1106 is on the top floor that can been rented ( it is on the 5th floor ) and has beautiful views because it is on the oceanside end. Spectacular Views ! There is an elevator to this building and it makes it convenient with groceries and packages. The unit was spotless , like new and everything worked perfectly. There are three flat screen 40 inch TV's ( one with a DVD in the living room ) with a great assortment of DVD's to view, they also have cable channels HBO/SHOWTIME/ FOX, CNBC and others. There are books to read and games to play in the unit. The beds are the best I've ever slept on - very comfortable. Linens and sheets are excellent.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service at Princess Heights is second to none. FIRST CLASS ! The front office workers help you with anything and everything. The housekeepers are great ! The surroundings and views are gorgeous. It is a meticulously well maintained property.
reviews.title: Loved Princess Heights!

aka: Princess Heights Hotel St. Maarten/St. Martin
description: Located on a hillside overlooking dawn beach, this affordable Luxury Boutique Condo Hotel offers Studios, One & Two bedroom Suites with fully equipped gourmet kitchens and balconies with majestic ocean views. On site hotel amenities include a freshwater pool, free internet, free parking, free daily newspaper, daily maid service, gym room and concierge service. Additional services include: Car rental, Cell phone rental, Beach chair & umbrella rental. 5 Restaurants close by. It’s 10 min to Philipsburg, 15 min to Orient Bay and a 4-minute walk to Dawn Beach.
